org.switchyard

Interface Context


  • public interface Context
    Holds contextual information around the exchange of messages between a service consumer and provider.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<Property> getProperties()
      Returns the set of all properties in this context.
      Set<Property> getProperties(Scope scope)
      Returns the set of all properties in this context in the specified scope.
      Set<Property> getProperties(String label)
      Get all properties with a given label.
      Property getProperty(String name)
      Retrieves the named property within this context, regardless of the scope.
      Property getProperty(String name, Scope scope)
      Retrieves the value of the named property with the given scope in this context.
      <T> T getPropertyValue(String name)
      Retrieves the value of the named property within this context, regardless of the scope.
      void mergeInto(Context context)
      Merges the properties in this Context instance into the specified Context instance, adding missing values and overwriting existing values.
      void removeProperties()
      Removes all properties from this context.
      void removeProperties(Scope scope)
      Removes properties from the specified scope from this context.
      void removeProperties(String label)
      Remove all properties with a given label.
      void removeProperty(Property property)
      Removes the named property from this context.

      Adds the set of properties to this context.
      Property setProperty(String name, Object val)
      Sets the named context property with the specified value.
      Property setProperty(String name, Object val, Scope scope)
      Sets the named context property with the specified value in a specific scope.

    • Method Detail

      • mergeInto

        void mergeInto(Context context)
        Merges the properties in this Context instance into the specified Context instance, adding missing values and overwriting existing values. A shallow copy of context property values is performed, so values that are references will be shared between the two contexts.

        Properties with a label of Labels.TRANSIENT are not included in the merge.
        Parameters:
        context - context properties are copied from this context

      • getProperty

        Property getProperty(String name)
        Retrieves the named property within this context, regardless of the scope.
        Parameters:
        name - property name
        Returns:
        value of the property in this context or null if the property does not exist

      • getProperty

        Property getProperty(String name,
                   Scope scope)
        Retrieves the value of the named property with the given scope in this context.
        Parameters:
        name - property name
        scope - property scope
        Returns:
        value of the property in this context or null if the property does not exist

      • getPropertyValue

        <T> T getPropertyValue(String name)
        Retrieves the value of the named property within this context, regardless of the scope. This is a convenience method equivalent to getProperty(name).getValue() .
        Type Parameters:
        T - Expected type of property.
        Parameters:
        name - property name
        Returns:
        value of the property in this context or null if the property does not exist

      • getProperties

        Set<Property> getProperties()
        Returns the set of all properties in this context. The returned set is a shallow copy of the properties set in this context, so modifications to the map are not reflected in the underlying context.
        Returns:
        set containing all properties in this context. If there are no properties in this context, an empty set is returned.

      • getProperties

        Set<Property> getProperties(Scope scope)
        Returns the set of all properties in this context in the specified scope. The returned set is a shallow copy of the properties set in this context, so modifications to the map are not reflected in the underlying context.
        Parameters:
        scope - scope from which properties will be retrieved
        Returns:
        set containing all properties in this context for the specified scope. If there are no properties in the scope, an empty set is returned.

      • getProperties

        Set<Property> getProperties(String label)
        Get all properties with a given label.
        Parameters:
        label - the label each property must have
        Returns:
        set of properties with the specified label

      • removeProperty

        void removeProperty(Property property)
        Removes the named property from this context.
        Parameters:
        property - property to remove not exist

      • removeProperties

        void removeProperties()
        Removes all properties from this context.

      • removeProperties

        void removeProperties(Scope scope)
        Removes properties from the specified scope from this context.
        Parameters:
        scope - scope of the properties to remove

      • removeProperties

        void removeProperties(String label)
        Remove all properties with a given label.
        Parameters:
        label - the label each property must have

      • setProperty

        Property setProperty(String name,
                   Object val)
        Sets the named context property with the specified value. If the context property does not exist already, it is added. If the property already exists, the value of the property is replaced.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the property to set
        val - the value to set for the property
        Returns:
        a reference to the set Property

      • setProperty

        Property setProperty(String name,
                   Object val,
                   Scope scope)
        Sets the named context property with the specified value in a specific scope. If the context property does not exist already, it is added. If the property already exists, the value of the property is replaced. If the specified value is null, the property is removed from the context.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the property to set
        val - the value to set for the property
        scope - scope of the property to add
        Returns:
        a reference to the set Property

      • setProperties

        Context setProperties(Set<Property> properties)
        Adds the set of properties to this context.
        Parameters:
        properties - set of properties to add
        Returns:
        a reference to the updated Context
